availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: W. M. Wells (Caldwell Co., KY, blacksmith)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, blacksmith. Fayette County, Kentucky, native. Married to Wilmoth Boyd Wells in Trigg County, Kentucky, on December 29, 1828. Father of Madison Well, Miriam Wells, Horace Wells, James Wells, William Wells, Margaret Wells, and Frank Wells. Blacksmith in Caldwell County in 1850. Blacksmith in Caldwell County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1 p. 279A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, p. 118.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, p. 218A.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #11057.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trigg County Marriages, 1820-1864, Film #000321335.
William Bedford Coles, The Coles family of Virginia, its numerous connections from the emigration to America to the year 1915 (New York, 1931), 276.
